_header: My ladies and my mistresses each one
Note:
For one stanza occurring separately see 6543; cf. Dodsley (1827)
XDodsley, Robert. A Select Collection of Old Plays. 12 vols. London: H. Nichols, 1780, 1827, 12.308.
Subjects: women, praise of; women, good qualities of; old age, praise of; marriage
_description: Ragmanys Rolle — 208 lines in twenty-six 8-line stanzas

Bod638.First Lines:
My ladies & my mastressys echonlike hit vnto youre humble
                    womanhede…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…And yn the Rolle last as yn wrytyngeI rede that this game
                    ende yn youre hood
Bod638.Attributed Title:
Ragmanys Rolle (scribal, 214v, RT); Explicit Ragmanys Rolle
                    (scribal, 218v)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela.

             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.

Freudenberger,  Andreas,
                        ed.  
             Ragman Roll: Ein spätmittelenglisches Gedicht.
         Erlangen: K.B. Hof, 1909: 2-16.

BodFair16.First Lines:
My ladyes and my maistresses echonelyke hit vnto your humbyble
                    wommanhede…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…and in the rolle last as in wrytyngeI rede that this game
                    ende in your hood
BodFair16.Attributed Title:
Here begynnyth Ragman roell (f. 47); Explicit Ragman roell (f.
                    50)
